title.value: Approach Intelligent Writing Assistants Usability with Seven Stages of Action
title.justification: This is the title provided at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Approach Intelligent Writing Assistants Usability with Seven Stages of Action

extractions.description: The paper discusses adopting Norman’s seven stages of action as a framework for improving the interaction design of intelligent writing assistants supported by Large Language Models (LLMs). It provides examples and discusses implications for usability and human-LLM interaction research.

type.justification: The paper mainly proposes a framework and discusses its implications, rather than conducting experiments or empirical evaluations.
type.quote: In this position paper, we propose to adopt Norman’s seven stages of action as a framework to approach the interaction design of intelligent writing assistants.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the interaction design and usability of intelligent writing assistants.
name.quote: we propose to adopt Norman’s seven stages of action as a framework to approach the interaction design of intelligent writing assistants.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses Large Language Models (LLMs), which are a key aspect of natural language processing.
name.quote: The recent progress in writing assistants has been centred around Large Language Models (LLMs)

name.justification: The paper discusses usability issues and presents a framework focused on improving usability.
name.quote: The paper also discusses the framework as a tool to synthesize research on the interaction design of LLM-based tools and presents examples of tools that support the stages of action.
